column1: The parathyroid glands cannot be felt with the hands.
The level of parathyroid hormone (PTH) in your blood will also be checked.
Tell your health care provider if you have any drug allergies or bleeding problems, or if you are pregnant.
Tell your health care provider if you are taking any blood thinning medications (aspirin, heparin, Lovenox, warfarin), because you may have to stop taking them a few days before the procedure.
The parathyroid glands release parathyroid hormone (PTH).
This hormone controls the level of calcium in the body.
This procedure is most often done to rule out cancer as a cause of high parathyroid hormone levels.
Abnormal PTH levels may also be a cause of hypercalcemia.
In rare cases, some people develop temporary hoarseness when the nerve that runs close to the parathyroid glands is injured.
